review:
Dr. Sujoy Dasgupta is the reason of our happiness after spending years of sleepless nights. We tried for IVF-ICSI which failed for the first time, but we never lost hope on the doctor. We attempted for IVF again under him and on 6th Nov 2023, we were blessed with a baby boy.

We started the treatment under Dr. Dasgupta during the starting of 2022. He shared the pros and cons of all treatment procedures and presented us the choices for IUI and IVF. His detailed information, especially considering my advanced maternal age, helped us to opt for IVF. He also shared a book authored by him regarding details of IVF pregnancy during the visit which clarified almost all the doubts and any questions that we had.

The second IVF attempt was progressing smoothly till ovum pickup. We were planning to freeze the embryo and plan for pregnancy later, but doctor suggested for immediate Embryo Transfer within 3 days of pickup, considering the quality of the embryo and the history of the failure of embryo formation during the first attempt. Despite the sudden pregnancy decision was hard to take still we decided to trust him. The pregnancy progressed smoothly till 3rd trimester, although low PAPP-A was detected in NT scan (signifying the growth restriction of placenta). The baby was detected with late onset IUGR in the early 3rd trimester. My son was even not required to be admitted in NICU and stayed with me throughout the hospitalization.

He is a patient centric doctor who also considers the financial aspects of his patients, which proved to be more helpful to us as we are from a middle class background. Throughout the journey, he explained the pros and cons of most of the medicines and the treatment transparently, never hiding any facts.

Thank you sir for your priceless consultations and guidances. Our dream has come true after long years of struggle.

And weight loss can definitely improve the chance of pregnancy and decrease the risk of miscarriage and other complications in pregnancy. Thank you Mrs Alam for staying with us.

reply_text:
Your semen analysis was done from a laboratory which is not specialized in infertility treatment. Moreover, scientifically, a single semen analysis is not at all reliable and no treatment can be done based on a single semen analysis. Therefore, it is always advisable to do semen analysis from infertility laboratory to confirm whether it is actually good or bad. Many times we have seen the second semen analysis report is completely different. 
In any infertility clinic of the World, both husband and wife need to come together. Even if there is problem in husband's sperm only, the wife need to be seen by the infertility specialist who will discuss the treatment ONLY after seeing reports of both. In our centre, the charge Rs 1200 includes 
1. Consultation charges for both husband and wife 
2. Psychological counseling, which is mandatory for any infertility clinic as per Govt of India 
3. TVS ultrasound for wife.
You paid the charge and we offered you all these but you refused treatment and any test for your wife.
You wanted to act very smart and you thought only your report will be checked. Medicine practice has its rule and you can NOT change the way of treatment. We requested you to do evaluation of your wife which would have been done without spending anything extra. But you refused that. You repeatedly insisted on medicines. Before giving any medicine we need to see whether medicine is actually needed. But you were very much stubborn and you thought you know everything of infertility treatment. 
We are thankful that our patients rely completely on us when they come to our clinic. 
I will advise you to write a book on infertility treatment where you can dictate how treatment should be done. Good luck.

Therefore in future when you visit any doctor, please remember,
1) all patients may not get equal time in consultation. The time depends on the severity of the problem patient is suffering.
2) don't compete with other patients regarding time
3) don't ask the doctor to judge the prescription of another doctor. (You purposefully avoided explanation of this).
4) the spelling of the tests can be asked from the laboratory.
Good luck.
